intro: Fraxinus hupehensis, commonly known as the Chinese ash, is a deciduous tree native to China. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters with a broad, spreading crown. The tree has opposite, simple leaves that are ovate to elliptic in shape, with serrated margins. Its flowers are small, greenish-yellow, and appear in clusters, followed by winged fruits that mature in the fall. The bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming fissured with age.
